page.title: 01HOUSING IN TRELAWNYD
page.content: There has not been any private development in the village for the past five years,since the completion of a small estate of bungalows. However, the Council have built sheltered accommodation for the elderly in the centre of the village. There is planning for an estate of about 35 houses to be erected on the village outskirts. There is still evidence of many houses built in the 19th century. Approximately half of the homes in the village are Council owned, though there is evidence that many of these have been purchased from the Council by the occupants.The close knit community reflects the mature age of many of the residents, who live in compact type homes rather any modern luxurious residences.
